pli-tv-bu-vb-sk66:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk66:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk66:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six gave teachings to people wearing headdresses. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk66:1.3.1: “‘I will not give a teaching to anyone wearing a headdress who is not sick,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk66:1.5: if the ends of the hair are not showing it is a headdress.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk66:1.6: One should not give a teaching to anyone wearing a headdress who is not sick.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk66:1.7: If a monk, out of disrespect, gives a teaching to someone wearing a headdress who is not sick, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk66:1.13: if he teaches the person after having them uncover the ends of their hair;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk66:1.16: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk66:1.17: The sixth training rule is finished.
